pages.text: Teleocrater is a Triassic Aphanosaurian archosaur. With a total length of about 2 m, Teleocrater is characterized by its long neck. Contrary to what is thought from its small sauropod-like appearance, Teleocrater is carnivorous animal with sharp teeth. Aphanosauria is important in considering the evolution of dinosaurs and pterosaurs.

Aphanosauria is the only avemetatarsalian known to have branched from a common ancestor of Ornithodira, a group that includes dinosaurs (including birds) and pterosaurs. Unlike most ornithodirans, Teleocrater is not good at running, given its hind leg anatomy.
